intro: Ottonia mexiae var. fertilior, commonly known as the Mexican ottonia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
